The game starts with four pieces placed in the center of the board. shaped like a square, two with the white side facing up and two with the side black. The player who makes the first move is chosen randomly.

In order for a player to place a piece on a cell off the board, there must be at least one straight line (horizontal, vertical or diagonal) without empty spaces between the position the player wants and another piece of his color, and that there are one or more opponent\'s pieces between them.
If there are no valid moves the player must pass the turn.

Once a player makes a valid move, all opponent\'s pieces that are in a straight line (horizontal, vertical or diagonal) between the newly placed piece and any other player\'s pieces, are turned over and become that player\'s color.
There are two special moves that the player can use only once during the game. These special moves are unlocked after each player has made 4 moves.
A player can use the bomb on his own piece to destroy all the pieces directly. adjacent to it.
A player can use the exchange, offering two of his pieces to the opponent and then choose an opponent\'s piece for yourself.

The game ends when none of the players can make moves, that is, when all squares are occupied or all pieces on the board are the same color flipped up. If a player has more pieces than the opponent, he wins. If both players have the same amount of pieces, the game ends in a draw.
A player can remove the Hints if they wish by clicking on the Hints button.
